meanings.definition: To edit excessively or too much.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overedit her essays until they lose their original meaning.
meanings.sent2: I always overedit my photos before posting them online.
meanings.sent3: He overedited his speech so much that it sounded like a robot.
meanings.sent4: Her constant need to overedit everything is like trying to paint a perfect picture with too many brush strokes.
meanings.sent5: The writer's tendency to overedit made the story lose its charm and authenticity.

meanings.definition: The act of editing something excessively.
meanings.sent1: His overedit of the document led to confusion among the team members.
meanings.sent2: The overedit of the video made it lose its natural flow.
meanings.sent3: The overedit of the movie trailer made it unintentionally hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The overedit of the photo album turned it into a chaotic mess.
meanings.sent5: The overedit of the manuscript made it unreadable and unrecognizable.
